cellularAutomata.cellState.view
Class RealValuedDefaultView

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.cellState.view.CellStateView
      cellularAutomata.cellState.view.TriangleHexagonCellStateView
          cellularAutomata.cellState.view.RealValuedDefaultView

public class RealValuedDefaultView
extends TriangleHexagonCellStateView

A view that displays real numbers as a shaded value between a lower and upper bound. Also displays triangles and hexagons on their respective lattices.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

RealValuedDefaultView

public RealValuedDefaultView(double lowerBound,
                             double upperBound)
Create a view that displays scaled shades between the value of the lower and upper bound.

Parameters:
lowerBound - The smaller of two double numbers whose value is used to represent a lighter color.
upperBound - The larger of two double numbers whose value is used to represent a darker color.
Method Detail

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor(CellState state,
                               java.lang.Integer numStates,
                               Coordinate rowAndCol)
Creates a display color based on the magnitude of the double number in the cell. Creates a fractional shading between the default filled and empty colors.

Parameters:
state - The cell state that will be displayed.
numStates - If relevant, the number of possible states (which may not be the same as the currently active number of states) -- may be null which indicates that the number of states is inapplicable or that the currently active number of states should be used. (See for example, createProbabilityChoosers() method in InitialStatesPanel class.)
rowAndCol - The row and col of the cell being displayed. May be ignored.
Returns:
The color to be displayed.
